alert.note: Alert for Butler; Choctaw; Clarke; Crenshaw; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued March 13 at 1:47PM CDT until March 15 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 AM CDT TUESDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For tonights Freeze Warning, freezing temperatures of around 32 degrees possible. For Tuesday night`s Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 to 32 degrees possible. * WHERE...Choctaw, Clarke, Wilcox, Butler and Crenshaw Counties. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 7 AM CDT Tuesday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Given that temperatures have been well above normal for much of the past few weeks, we have issued the Freeze Watches as new, early season plant growth could be affected by a light freeze.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
